2970//                            seedA) * landModifier);
2971                    heatData[x][y] = (p = heat.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps
2972                                    + 0.375 * otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB + seedC)
2973                            , qs, seedB));
2974                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = moisture.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs
2975                                    + 0.375 * otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs, seedC + seedA)
2976                            , seedC));
2977                    minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, h);
2978                    maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, h);
2979                    if(fresh) {
2980                        minHeight = Math.min(minHeight, h);
2981                        maxHeight = Math.max(maxHeight, h);
2982
2983                        minHeat0 = Math.min(minHeat0, p);
2984                        maxHeat0 = Math.max(maxHeat0, p);
2985
2986                        minWet0 = Math.min(minWet0, temp);
2987                        maxWet0 = Math.max(maxWet0, temp);
2988                    }
2989                }
2990                minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, minHeight);
2991                maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, maxHeight);
2992
2993            }
2994            double  heatDiff = 0.8 / (maxHeat0 - minHeat0),
2995                    wetDiff = 1.0 / (maxWet0 - minWet0),
2996                    hMod,
2997                    halfHeight = (height - 1) * 0.5, i_half = 1.0 / halfHeight;
2998            yPos = startY + i_uh;
2999            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3000            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3001
3002            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
3003                temp = Math.abs(yPos - halfHeight) * i_half;
3004                temp *= (2.4 - temp);
3005                temp = 2.2 - temp;
3006                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
3007                    h = heightData[x][y];
3008                    if(heightCodeData[x][y] == 10000) {
3009                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 1000;
3010                        continue;
3011                    }
3012                    else
3013                        heightCodeData[x][y] = (t = codeHeight(h));
3014                    hMod = 1.0;
3015                    switch (t) {
3016                        case 0:
3017                        case 1:
3018                        case 2:
3019                        case 3:
3020                            h = 0.4;
3021                            hMod = 0.2;
3022                            break;
3023                        case 6:
3024                            h = -0.1 * (h - forestLower - 0.08);
3025                            break;
3026                        case 7:
3027                            h *= -0.25;
3028                            break;
3029                        case 8:
3030                            h *= -0.4;
3031                            break;
3032                        default:
3033                            h *= 0.05;
3034                    }
3035                    heatData[x][y] = (h = (((heatData[x][y] - minHeat0) * heatDiff * hMod) + h + 0.6) * temp);
3036                    if (fresh) {
3037                        ps = Math.min(ps, h); //minHeat0
3038                        pc = Math.max(pc, h); //maxHeat0
3039                    }
3040                }
3041            }
3042            if(fresh)
3043            {
3044                minHeat1 = ps;
3045                maxHeat1 = pc;
3046            }
3047            heatDiff = heatModifier / (maxHeat1 - minHeat1);
3048            qs = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3049            qc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3050            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3051            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3052
3053
3054            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
3055                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
3056                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat1) * heatDiff));
3057                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = (moistureData[x][y] - minWet0) * wetDiff);
3058                    if (fresh) {
3059                        qs = Math.min(qs, h);
3060                        qc = Math.max(qc, h);
3061                        ps = Math.min(ps, temp);
3062                        pc = Math.max(pc, temp);
3063                    }
3064                }
3065            }
3066            if(fresh)
3067            {
3068                minHeat = qs;
3069                maxHeat = qc;
3070                minWet = ps;
3071                maxWet = pc;
3072            }
3073            landData.refill(heightCodeData, 4, 999);
3074        }
3075    }
3076    /**
3077     * A concrete implementation of {@link WorldMapGenerator} that projects the world map onto a shape with a flat top
3078     * and bottom but near-circular sides. This is an equal-area projection, like EllipticalMap, so effects that fill
3079     * areas on a map like {@link PoliticalMapper} will fill (almost) equally on any part of the map. This has less
3080     * distortion on the far left and far right edges of the map than EllipticalMap, but the flat top and bottom are
3081     * probably very distorted in a small area near the poles.
3082     * This uses the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eckert_IV_projection">Eckert IV projection</a>.
3083     * <a href="https://yellowstonegames.github.io/SquidLib/RoundSideWorldMap.png">Example map</a>
3084     */
3085    public static class RoundSideMap extends WorldMapGenerator {
3086        //        protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.35, terrainRidgedFreq = 1.8, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375, riverRidgedFreq = 21.7;
3087        protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.45, terrainRidgedFreq = 2.6, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375;
3088        protected double minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
3089                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
3090                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3091
3092        public final Noise3D terrain, heat, moisture, otherRidged, terrainLayered;
3093        public final double[][] xPositions,
3094                yPositions,
3095                zPositions;
3096        protected final int[] edges;

3152         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later

3163         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
3164         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
3165         * Uses the given noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail. The suggested Noise3D
3166         * implementation to use is {@link FastNoise#instance}

3169         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later

3177        /**
3178         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
3179         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
3180         * Takes an initial seed, the width/height of the map, and parameters for noise generation (a
3181         * {@link Noise3D} implementation, where {@link FastNoise#instance} is suggested, and a
3182         * multiplier on how many octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers
3183         * producing even more detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
3184         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
3185         * cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in. FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
3186         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
3187         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
3188         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
3189         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
3190         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
3191         * that don't require zooming.
3192         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
3193         * @param mapWidth the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3194         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3195         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
3196         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
3197         */
3198        public RoundSideMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier) {
3199            super(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight);
3200            xPositions = new double[width][height];
3201            yPositions = new double[width][height];
3202            zPositions = new double[width][height];
3203            edges = new int[height << 1];
3204            terrain = new Noise.Maelstrom3D(new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 10), terrainFreq));
3205            terrainLayered = new Noise.Scaled3D(noiseGenerator,  terrainRidgedFreq * 0.325);
3206            heat = new Noise.Scaled3D(noiseGenerator,  heatFreq);
3207            moisture = new Noise.Scaled3D(noiseGenerator,  moistureFreq);
3208            otherRidged = new Noise.Maelstrom3D(new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 6), otherFreq));
3209        }

3236        @Override
3237        public int wrapX(final int x, int y) {
3238            y = Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
3239            if(x < edges[y << 1])
3240                return edges[y << 1 | 1];
3241            else if(x > edges[y << 1 | 1])
3242                return edges[y << 1];
3243            else return x;
3244        }
3245
3246        @Override
3247        public int wrapY(final int x, final int y)  {
3248            return Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
3249        }

3251        protected void regenerate(int startX, int startY, int usedWidth, int usedHeight,
3252                                  double landMod, double heatMod, int stateA, int stateB)
3253        {
3254            boolean fresh = false;
3255            if(cacheA != stateA || cacheB != stateB || landMod != landModifier || heatMod != heatModifier)
3256            {
3257                minHeight = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3258                maxHeight = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3259                minHeightActual = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3260                maxHeightActual = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3261                minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3262                maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3263                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3264                maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3265                minHeat = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3266                maxHeat = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3267                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3268                maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3269                minWet = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3270                maxWet = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3271                cacheA = stateA;
3272                cacheB = stateB;
3273                fresh = true;
3274            }
3275            rng.setState(stateA, stateB);
3276            long seedA = rng.nextLong(), seedB = rng.nextLong(), seedC = rng.nextLong();
3277            int t;
3278
3279            landModifier = (landMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.2) + 0.91 : landMod;
3280            heatModifier = (heatMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.45) * (rng.nextDouble()-0.5) + 1.1 : heatMod;
3281
3282            double p,
3283                    ps, pc,
3284                    qs, qc,
3285                    h, temp, yPos, xPos,
3286                    i_uw = usedWidth / (double)width,
3287                    i_uh = usedHeight / (double)height,
3288                    th, thb, thx, thy, lon, lat,
3289                    rx = width * 0.25, irx = 1.326500428177002 / rx, hw = width * 0.5,
3290                    ry = height * 0.5, iry = 1.0 / ry;
3291
3292            yPos = startY - ry;
3293            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
3294                thy = yPos * iry;//NumberTools.sin(thb);
3295                thb = NumberTools.asin(thy);
3296                thx = NumberTools.cos(thb);
3297                //1.3265004 0.7538633073600218  1.326500428177002
3298                lon = (thx == Math.PI * 0.5 || thx == Math.PI * -0.5) ? 0x1.0p100 : irx / (0.42223820031577125 * (1.0 + thx));
3299                qs = (thb + (thx + 2.0) * thy) * 0.2800495767557787;
3300                lat = NumberTools.asin(qs);
3301
3302                qc = NumberTools.cos(lat);
3303
3304                boolean inSpace = true;
3305                xPos = startX - hw;
3306                for (int x = 0/*, xt = 0*/; x < width; x++, xPos += i_uw) {
3307                    th = lon * xPos;
3308                    if(th < -3.141592653589793 || th > 3.141592653589793) {
3309                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 10000;
3310                        inSpace = true;
3311                        continue;
3312                    }
3313                    if(inSpace)
3314                    {
3315                        inSpace = false;
3316                        edges[y << 1] = x;
3317                    }
3318                    edges[y << 1 | 1] = x;
3319                    th += centerLongitude;
3320                    ps = NumberTools.sin(th) * qc;
3321                    pc = NumberTools.cos(th) * qc;
3322                    xPositions[x][y] = pc;
3323                    yPositions[x][y] = ps;
3324                    zPositions[x][y] = qs;
3325                    heightData[x][y] = (h = terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(pc +
3326                                    terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
3327                            ps, qs, seedA) + landModifier - 1.0);
3328                    heatData[x][y] = (p = heat.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps
3329                                    + 0.375 * otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB + seedC)
3330                            , qs, seedB));
3331                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = moisture.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs
3332                                    + 0.375 * otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs, seedC + seedA)
3333                            , seedC));
3334                    minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, h);
3335                    maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, h);
3336                    if(fresh) {
3337                        minHeight = Math.min(minHeight, h);
3338                        maxHeight = Math.max(maxHeight, h);
3339
3340                        minHeat0 = Math.min(minHeat0, p);
3341                        maxHeat0 = Math.max(maxHeat0, p);
3342
3343                        minWet0 = Math.min(minWet0, temp);
3344                        maxWet0 = Math.max(maxWet0, temp);
3345                    }
3346                }
3347                minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, minHeight);
3348                maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, maxHeight);
3349
3350            }
3351            double  heatDiff = 0.8 / (maxHeat0 - minHeat0),
3352                    wetDiff = 1.0 / (maxWet0 - minWet0),
3353                    hMod,
3354                    halfHeight = (height - 1) * 0.5, i_half = 1.0 / halfHeight;
3355            yPos = startY + i_uh;
3356            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3357            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3358
3359            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
3360                temp = Math.abs(yPos - halfHeight) * i_half;
3361                temp *= (2.4 - temp);
3362                temp = 2.2 - temp;
3363                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
3364                    h = heightData[x][y];
3365                    if(heightCodeData[x][y] == 10000) {
3366                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 1000;
3367                        continue;
3368                    }
3369                    else
3370                        heightCodeData[x][y] = (t = codeHeight(h));
3371                    hMod = 1.0;
3372                    switch (t) {
3373                        case 0:
3374                        case 1:
3375                        case 2:
3376                        case 3:
3377                            h = 0.4;
3378                            hMod = 0.2;
3379                            break;
3380                        case 6:
3381                            h = -0.1 * (h - forestLower - 0.08);
3382                            break;
3383                        case 7:
3384                            h *= -0.25;
3385                            break;
3386                        case 8:
3387                            h *= -0.4;
3388                            break;
3389                        default:
3390                            h *= 0.05;
3391                    }
3392                    heatData[x][y] = (h = (((heatData[x][y] - minHeat0) * heatDiff * hMod) + h + 0.6) * temp);
3393                    if (fresh) {
3394                        ps = Math.min(ps, h); //minHeat0
3395                        pc = Math.max(pc, h); //maxHeat0
3396                    }
3397                }
3398            }
3399            if(fresh)
3400            {
3401                minHeat1 = ps;
3402                maxHeat1 = pc;
3403            }
3404            heatDiff = heatModifier / (maxHeat1 - minHeat1);
3405            qs = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3406            qc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3407            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3408            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3409
3410
3411            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
3412                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
3413                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat1) * heatDiff));
3414                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = (moistureData[x][y] - minWet0) * wetDiff);
3415                    if (fresh) {
3416                        qs = Math.min(qs, h);
3417                        qc = Math.max(qc, h);
3418                        ps = Math.min(ps, temp);
3419                        pc = Math.max(pc, temp);
3420                    }
3421                }
3422            }
3423            if(fresh)
3424            {
3425                minHeat = qs;
3426                maxHeat = qc;
3427                minWet = ps;
3428                maxWet = pc;
3429            }
3430            landData.refill(heightCodeData, 4, 999);
3431        }

3433    /**
3434     * A concrete implementation of {@link WorldMapGenerator} that projects the world map onto a shape that resembles a
3435     * mix part-way between an ellipse and a rectangle. This is an equal-area projection, like EllipticalMap, so effects that fill
3436     * areas on a map like {@link PoliticalMapper} will fill (almost) equally on any part of the map. This has less
3437     * distortion around all the edges than the other maps here, especially when comparing the North and South poles
3438     * with RoundSideMap.
3439     * This uses the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tobler_hyperelliptical_projection">Tobler hyperelliptical projection</a>.

3470        /**
3471         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
3472         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
3473         * Takes only the width/height of the map. The initial seed is set to the same large long
3474         * every time, and it's likely that you would set the seed when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and

3481        public HyperellipticalMap(int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {

3536        /**
3537         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
3538         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
3539         * Takes an initial seed, the width/height of the map, and parameters for noise generation (a
3540         * {@link Noise3D} implementation, where {@link FastNoise#instance} is suggested, and a
3541         * multiplier on how many octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers
3542         * producing even more detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
3543         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
3544         * cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in. FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
3545         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
3546         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
3547         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
3548         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
3549         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
3550         * that don't require zooming.
3551         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
3552         * @param mapWidth the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3553         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3554         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
3555         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
3556         */
3557        public HyperellipticalMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier){
3558            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, noiseGenerator, octaveMultiplier, 0.0625, 2.5);
3559        }

3561        /**
3562         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
3563         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
3564         * Takes an initial seed, the width/height of the map, and parameters for noise generation (a
3565         * {@link Noise3D} implementation, where {@link FastNoise#instance} is suggested, and a
3566         * multiplier on how many octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers
3567         * producing even more detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
3568         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
3569         * cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in. FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
3570         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
3571         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
3572         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
3573         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
3574         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
3575         * that don't require zooming.
3576         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
3577         * @param mapWidth the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3578         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3579         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
3580         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
3581         * @param alpha one of the Tobler parameters;  0.0625 is the default and this can range from 0.0 to 1.0 at least
3582         * @param kappa one of the Tobler parameters; 2.5 is the default but 2.0-5.0 range values are also often used
3583         */
3584        public HyperellipticalMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator,
3585                                  double octaveMultiplier, double alpha, double kappa){
3586            super(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight);
3587            xPositions = new double[width][height];
3588            yPositions = new double[width][height];
3589            zPositions = new double[width][height];
3590            edges = new int[height << 1];
3591            terrain = new Noise.Maelstrom3D(new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 10), terrainFreq));
3592            terrainLayered = new Noise.Scaled3D(noiseGenerator,  terrainRidgedFreq * 0.325);
3593            heat = new Noise.Scaled3D(noiseGenerator,  heatFreq);
3594            moisture = new Noise.Scaled3D(noiseGenerator,  moistureFreq);
3595            otherRidged = new Noise.Maelstrom3D(new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 6), otherFreq));
3596            this.alpha = alpha;
3597            this.kappa = kappa;
3598            this.Z = new double[height << 2];
3599            this.epsilon = ProjectionTools.simpsonIntegrateHyperellipse(0.0, 1.0, 0.25 / height, kappa);
3600            ProjectionTools.simpsonODESolveHyperellipse(1, this.Z, 0.25 / height, alpha, kappa, epsilon);
3601        }
3602        /**
3603         * Copies the HyperellipticalMap {@code other} to construct a new one that is exactly the same. References will only
3604         * be shared to Noise classes.
3605         * @param other a HyperellipticalMap to copy
3606         */
3607        public HyperellipticalMap(HyperellipticalMap other)
3608        {
3609            super(other);
3610            terrain = other.terrain;
3611            terrainLayered = other.terrainLayered;
3612            heat = other.heat;
3613            moisture = other.moisture;
3614            otherRidged = other.otherRidged;
3615            minHeat0 = other.minHeat0;
3616            maxHeat0 = other.maxHeat0;
3617            minHeat1 = other.minHeat1;
3618            maxHeat1 = other.maxHeat1;
3619            minWet0 = other.minWet0;
3620            maxWet0 = other.maxWet0;
3621            xPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.xPositions);
3622            yPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.yPositions);
3623            zPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.zPositions);
3624            edges = Arrays.copyOf(other.edges, other.edges.length);
3625            alpha = other.alpha;
3626            kappa = other.kappa;
3627            epsilon = other.epsilon;
3628            Z = Arrays.copyOf(other.Z, other.Z.length);
3629        }

3632        @Override
3633        public int wrapX(final int x, int y) {
3634            y = Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
3635            if(x < edges[y << 1])
3636                return edges[y << 1 | 1];
3637            else if(x > edges[y << 1 | 1])
3638                return edges[y << 1];
3639            else return x;
3640        }
3641
3642        @Override
3643        public int wrapY(final int x, final int y)  {
3644            return Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
3645        }
3646
3647        /**
3648         * Given a latitude and longitude in radians (the conventional way of describing points on a globe), this gets the
3649         * (x,y) Coord on the map projection this generator uses that corresponds to the given lat-lon coordinates. If this
3650         * generator does not represent a globe (if it is toroidal, for instance) or if there is no "good way" to calculate
3651         * the projection for a given lat-lon coordinate, this returns null. This implementation never returns null.
3652         * If this is a supported operation and the parameters are valid, this returns a Coord with x between 0 and
3653         * {@link #width}, and y between 0 and {@link #height}, both exclusive. Automatically wraps the Coord's values using
3654         * {@link #wrapX(int, int)} and {@link #wrapY(int, int)}.
3655         *
3656         * @param latitude  the latitude, from {@code Math.PI * -0.5} to {@code Math.PI * 0.5}
3657         * @param longitude the longitude, from {@code 0.0} to {@code Math.PI * 2.0}
3658         * @return the point at the given latitude and longitude, as a Coord with x between 0 and {@link #width} and y between 0 and {@link #height}, or null if unsupported
3659         */
3660        @Override
3661        public Coord project(double latitude, double longitude) {
3662            final double z0 = Math.abs(NumberTools.sin(latitude));
3663            final int i = Arrays.binarySearch(Z, z0);
3664            final double y;
3665            if (i >= 0)
3666                y = i/(Z.length-1.);
3667            else if (-i-1 >= Z.length)
3668                y = Z[Z.length-1];
3669            else
3670                y = ((z0-Z[-i-2])/(Z[-i-1]-Z[-i-2]) + (-i-2))/(Z.length-1.);
3671            final int xx = (int)(((longitude - getCenterLongitude() + 12.566370614359172) % 6.283185307179586) * Math.abs(alpha + (1-alpha)*Math.pow(1 - Math.pow(Math.abs(y),kappa), 1/kappa)) + 0.5);
3672            final int yy = (int)(y * Math.signum(latitude) * height * 0.5 + 0.5);
3673            return Coord.get(wrapX(xx, yy), wrapY(xx, yy));
3674        }
3675
3676        protected void regenerate(int startX, int startY, int usedWidth, int usedHeight,
3677                                  double landMod, double heatMod, int stateA, int stateB)
3678        {
3679            boolean fresh = false;
3680            if(cacheA != stateA || cacheB != stateB || landMod != landModifier || heatMod != heatModifier)
3681            {
3682                minHeight = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3683                maxHeight = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3684                minHeightActual = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3685                maxHeightActual = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3686                minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3687                maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3688                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3689                maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3690                minHeat = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3691                maxHeat = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3692                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3693                maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3694                minWet = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3695                maxWet = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3696                cacheA = stateA;
3697                cacheB = stateB;
3698                fresh = true;
3699            }
3700            rng.setState(stateA, stateB);
3701            long seedA = rng.nextLong(), seedB = rng.nextLong(), seedC = rng.nextLong();
3702            int t;
3703
3704            landModifier = (landMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.2) + 0.91 : landMod;
3705            heatModifier = (heatMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.45) * (rng.nextDouble()-0.5) + 1.1 : heatMod;
3706
3707            double p,
3708                    ps, pc,
3709                    qs, qc,
3710                    h, temp, yPos, xPos,
3711                    i_uw = usedWidth / (double)width,
3712                    i_uh = usedHeight / (double)height,
3713                    th, lon,
3714                    rx = width * 0.5, irx = Math.PI / rx, hw = width * 0.5,
3715                    ry = height * 0.5, iry = 1.0 / ry;
3716
3717            yPos = startY - ry;
3718            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
3719//                thy = yPos * iry;//NumberTools.sin(thb);
3720//                thb = asin(thy);
3721//                thx = NumberTools.cos(thb);
3722//                //1.3265004 0.7538633073600218  1.326500428177002
3723//                lon = (thx == Math.PI * 0.5 || thx == Math.PI * -0.5) ? 0x1.0p100 : irx / (0.42223820031577125 * (1.0 + thx));
3724//                qs = (thb + (thx + 2.0) * thy) * 0.2800495767557787;
3725//                lat = asin(qs);
3726//
3727//                qc = NumberTools.cos(lat);
3728
3729                lon = NumberTools.asin(Z[(int)(0.5 + Math.abs(yPos*iry)*(Z.length-1))])*Math.signum(yPos);
3730                qs = NumberTools.sin(lon);
3731                qc = NumberTools.cos(lon);
3732
3733                boolean inSpace = true;
3734                xPos = startX - hw;
3735                for (int x = 0/*, xt = 0*/; x < width; x++, xPos += i_uw) {
3736                    //th = lon * xPos;
3737                    th = xPos * irx / Math.abs(alpha + (1-alpha)*ProjectionTools.hyperellipse(yPos * iry, kappa));
3738                    if(th < -3.141592653589793 || th > 3.141592653589793) {
3739                        //if(th < -2.0 || th > 2.0) {
3740                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 10000;
3741                        inSpace = true;
3742                        continue;
3743                    }
3744                    if(inSpace)
3745                    {
3746                        inSpace = false;
3747                        edges[y << 1] = x;
3748                    }
3749                    edges[y << 1 | 1] = x;
3750                    th += centerLongitude;
3751                    ps = NumberTools.sin(th) * qc;
3752                    pc = NumberTools.cos(th) * qc;
3753                    xPositions[x][y] = pc;
3754                    yPositions[x][y] = ps;
3755                    zPositions[x][y] = qs;
3756                    heightData[x][y] = (h = terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(pc +
3757                                    terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs, seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
3758                            ps, qs, seedA) + landModifier - 1.0);
3759                    heatData[x][y] = (p = heat.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps
3760                                    + 0.375 * otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs, seedB + seedC)
3761                            , qs, seedB));
3762                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = moisture.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs
3763                                    + 0.375 * otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs, seedC + seedA)
3764                            , seedC));
3765                    minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, h);
3766                    maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, h);
3767                    if(fresh) {
3768                        minHeight = Math.min(minHeight, h);
3769                        maxHeight = Math.max(maxHeight, h);
3770
3771                        minHeat0 = Math.min(minHeat0, p);
3772                        maxHeat0 = Math.max(maxHeat0, p);
3773
3774                        minWet0 = Math.min(minWet0, temp);
3775                        maxWet0 = Math.max(maxWet0, temp);
3776                    }
3777                }
3778                minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, minHeight);
3779                maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, maxHeight);
3780
3781            }
3782            double  heatDiff = 0.8 / (maxHeat0 - minHeat0),
3783                    wetDiff = 1.0 / (maxWet0 - minWet0),
3784                    hMod,
3785                    halfHeight = (height - 1) * 0.5, i_half = 1.0 / halfHeight;
3786            yPos = startY + i_uh;
3787            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3788            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3789
3790            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
3791                temp = Math.abs(yPos - halfHeight) * i_half;
3792                temp *= (2.4 - temp);
3793                temp = 2.2 - temp;
3794                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
3795                    h = heightData[x][y];
3796                    if(heightCodeData[x][y] == 10000) {
3797                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 1000;
3798                        continue;
3799                    }
3800                    else
3801                        heightCodeData[x][y] = (t = codeHeight(h));
3802                    hMod = 1.0;
3803                    switch (t) {
3804                        case 0:
3805                        case 1:
3806                        case 2:
3807                        case 3:
3808                            h = 0.4;
3809                            hMod = 0.2;
3810                            break;
3811                        case 6:
3812                            h = -0.1 * (h - forestLower - 0.08);
3813                            break;
3814                        case 7:
3815                            h *= -0.25;
3816                            break;
3817                        case 8:
3818                            h *= -0.4;
3819                            break;
3820                        default:
3821                            h *= 0.05;
3822                    }
3823                    heatData[x][y] = (h = (((heatData[x][y] - minHeat0) * heatDiff * hMod) + h + 0.6) * temp);
3824                    if (fresh) {
3825                        ps = Math.min(ps, h); //minHeat0
3826                        pc = Math.max(pc, h); //maxHeat0
3827                    }
3828                }
3829            }
3830            if(fresh)
3831            {
3832                minHeat1 = ps;
3833                maxHeat1 = pc;
3834            }
3835            heatDiff = heatModifier / (maxHeat1 - minHeat1);
3836            qs = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3837            qc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3838            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
3839            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3840
3841
3842            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
3843                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
3844                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat1) * heatDiff));
3845                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = (moistureData[x][y] - minWet0) * wetDiff);
3846                    if (fresh) {
3847                        qs = Math.min(qs, h);
3848                        qc = Math.max(qc, h);
3849                        ps = Math.min(ps, temp);
3850                        pc = Math.max(pc, temp);
3851                    }
3852                }
3853            }
3854            if(fresh)
3855            {
3856                minHeat = qs;
3857                maxHeat = qc;
3858                minWet = ps;
3859                maxWet = pc;
3860            }
3861            landData.refill(heightCodeData, 4, 999);
3862        }
3863    }

3865    /**
3866     * A concrete implementation of {@link WorldMapGenerator} that projects the world map onto an ellipse that should be
3867     * twice as wide as it is tall (although you can stretch it by width and height that don't have that ratio).
3868     * This uses the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hammer_projection">Hammer projection</a>, so the latitude
3869     * lines are curved instead of flat. The Mollweide projection that {@link EllipticalMap} uses has flat lines, but
3870     * the two projection are otherwise very similar, and are both equal-area (Hammer tends to have less significant
3871     * distortion around the edges, but the curvature of the latitude lines can be hard to visualize).
3872     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/nmN6lMK.gifv">Preview image link of a world rotating</a>.
3873     */
3874    public static class EllipticalHammerMap extends WorldMapGenerator {
3875        //        protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.35, terrainRidgedFreq = 1.8, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375, riverRidgedFreq = 21.7;
3876        protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.45, terrainRidgedFreq = 2.6, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375;
3877        protected double minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
3878                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
3879                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
3880
3881        public final Noise3D terrain, heat, moisture, otherRidged, terrainLayered;
3882        public final double[][] xPositions,
3883                yPositions,
3884                zPositions;
3885        protected final int[] edges;
3886
3887
3888        /**
3889         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
3890         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape. This is very
3891         * similar to {@link EllipticalMap}, but has curved latitude lines instead of flat ones (it also may see more
3892         * internal usage because some operations on this projection are much faster and simpler).
3893         * Always makes a 200x100 map.
3894         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
3895         * If you were using {@link EllipticalHammerMap#EllipticalHammerMap(long, int, int, Noise3D, double)}, then this would be the
3896         * same as passing the parameters {@code 0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 200, 100, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0}.
3897         */
3898        public EllipticalHammerMap() {
3899            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 200, 100, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
3900        }
3901
3902        /**
3903         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
3904         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape. This is very
3905         * similar to {@link EllipticalMap}, but has curved latitude lines instead of flat ones (it also may see more
3906         * internal usage because some operations on this projection are much faster and simpler).
3907         * Takes only the width/height of the map. The initial seed is set to the same large long
3908         * every time, and it's likely that you would set the seed when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and
3909         * height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
3910         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
3911         *
3912         * @param mapWidth  the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3913         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3914         */
3915        public EllipticalHammerMap(int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
3916            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, mapWidth, mapHeight,  DEFAULT_NOISE,1.0);
3917        }

3921         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape. This is very
3922         * similar to {@link EllipticalMap}, but has curved latitude lines instead of flat ones (it also may see more
3923         * internal usage because some operations on this projection are much faster and simpler).
3924         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
3925         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
3926         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
3927         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
3928         *

3943         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
3944         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.

3946         *

3948         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3949         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3950         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
3951         */

3956        /**
3957         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
3958         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape. This is very
3959         * similar to {@link EllipticalMap}, but has curved latitude lines instead of flat ones (it also may see more
3960         * internal usage because some operations on this projection are much faster and simpler).
3961         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
3962         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
3963         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
3964         * Uses the given noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail. The suggested Noise3D
3965         * implementation to use is {@link FastNoise#instance}.
3966         *
3967         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
3968         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3969         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3970         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
3971         */
3972        public EllipticalHammerMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator) {

3976        /**
3977         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
3978         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape. This is very
3979         * similar to {@link EllipticalMap}, but has curved latitude lines instead of flat ones (it also may see more
3980         * internal usage because some operations on this projection are much faster and simpler).
3981         * Takes an initial seed, the width/height of the map, and parameters for noise generation (a
3982         * {@link Noise3D} implementation, where {@link FastNoise#instance} is suggested, and a
3983         * multiplier on how many octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers
3984         * producing even more detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
3985         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
3986         * cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in. FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
3987         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
3988         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
3989         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
3990         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
3991         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
3992         * that don't require zooming.
3993         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
3994         * @param mapWidth the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3995         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
3996         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
3997         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
3998         */
3999        public EllipticalHammerMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier) {
4000            super(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight);
4001            xPositions = new double[width][height];
4002            yPositions = new double[width][height];
4003            zPositions = new double[width][height];
4004            edges = new int[height << 1];
4005            terrain = new Noise.Maelstrom3D(new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 10), terrainFreq));
4006            terrainLayered = new Noise.Scaled3D(noiseGenerator,  terrainRidgedFreq * 0.325);
4007            heat = new Noise.Scaled3D(noiseGenerator,  heatFreq);
4008            moisture = new Noise.Scaled3D(noiseGenerator,  moistureFreq);
4009            otherRidged = new Noise.Maelstrom3D(new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 6), otherFreq));
4010        }
4011
4012        /**
4013         * Copies the EllipticalHammerMap {@code other} to construct a new one that is exactly the same. References will only
4014         * be shared to Noise classes.
4015         * @param other an EllipticalHammerMap to copy
4016         */
4017        public EllipticalHammerMap(EllipticalHammerMap other)
4018        {
4019            super(other);
4020            terrain = other.terrain;
4021            terrainLayered = other.terrainLayered;
4022            heat = other.heat;
4023            moisture = other.moisture;
4024            otherRidged = other.otherRidged;
4025            minHeat0 = other.minHeat0;
4026            maxHeat0 = other.maxHeat0;
4027            minHeat1 = other.minHeat1;
4028            maxHeat1 = other.maxHeat1;
4029            minWet0 = other.minWet0;
4030            maxWet0 = other.maxWet0;
4031            xPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.xPositions);
4032            yPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.yPositions);
4033            zPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.zPositions);
4034            edges = Arrays.copyOf(other.edges, other.edges.length);
4035        }
4036
4037        @Override
4038        public int wrapX(final int x, int y) {
4039            y = Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
4040            if(x < edges[y << 1])
4041                return edges[y << 1 | 1];
4042            else if(x > edges[y << 1 | 1])
4043                return edges[y << 1];
4044            else return x;
4045        }
4046
4047        @Override
4048        public int wrapY(final int x, final int y)  {
4049            return Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
4050        }
4051
4052        protected void regenerate(int startX, int startY, int usedWidth, int usedHeight,
4053                                  double landMod, double heatMod, int stateA, int stateB)
4054        {
4055            boolean fresh = false;
4056            if(cacheA != stateA || cacheB != stateB || landMod != landModifier || heatMod != heatModifier)
4057            {
4058                minHeight = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4059                maxHeight = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4060                minHeightActual = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4061                maxHeightActual = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4062                minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4063                maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4064                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4065                maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4066                minHeat = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4067                maxHeat = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4068                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4069                maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4070                minWet = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4071                maxWet = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4072                cacheA = stateA;
4073                cacheB = stateB;
4074                fresh = true;
4075            }
4076            rng.setState(stateA, stateB);
4077            long seedA = rng.nextLong(), seedB = rng.nextLong(), seedC = rng.nextLong();
4078            int t;
4079
4080            landModifier = (landMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.2) + 0.91 : landMod;
4081            heatModifier = (heatMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.45) * (rng.nextDouble()-0.5) + 1.1 : heatMod;
4082
4083            double p,
4084                    ps, pc,
4085                    qs, qc,
4086                    h, temp, yPos, xPos,
4087                    z, th, lon, lat,
4088                    rx = width * 0.5, hw = width * 0.5, root2 = Math.sqrt(2.0),
4089                    irx = 1.0 / rx, iry = 2.0 / (double) height,
4090                    xAdj, yAdj,
4091                    i_uw = usedWidth / (double)(width),
4092                    i_uh = usedHeight / (double)(height);
4093
4094            yPos = (startY - height * 0.5);
4095            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
4096                boolean inSpace = true;
4097                yAdj = yPos * iry;
4098                xPos = (startX - hw);
4099                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++, xPos += i_uw) {
4100                    xAdj = xPos * irx;
4101                    z = Math.sqrt(1.0 - 0.5 * xAdj * xAdj - 0.5 * yAdj * yAdj);
4102                    th = z * yAdj * root2;
4103                    lon = 2.0 * NumberTools.atan2((2.0 * z * z - 1.0), (z * xAdj * root2));
4104                    if(th != th || lon < 0.0) {
4105                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 10000;
4106                        inSpace = true;
4107                        continue;
4108                    }
4109                    lat = NumberTools.asin(th);
4110                    qc = NumberTools.cos(lat);
4111                    qs = th;
4112                    th = Math.PI - lon + centerLongitude;
4113                    if(inSpace)
4114                    {
4115                        inSpace = false;
4116                        edges[y << 1] = x;
4117                    }
4118                    edges[y << 1 | 1] = x;
4119                    ps = NumberTools.sin(th) * qc;
4120                    pc = NumberTools.cos(th) * qc;
4121                    xPositions[x][y] = pc;
4122                    yPositions[x][y] = ps;
4123                    zPositions[x][y] = qs;
4124                    heightData[x][y] = (h = terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(pc +
4125                                    terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
4126                            ps, qs, seedA) + landModifier - 1.0);
4127                    heatData[x][y] = (p = heat.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps
4128                                    + 0.375 * otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB + seedC)
4129                            , qs, seedB));
4130                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = moisture.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs
4131                                    + 0.375 * otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs, seedC + seedA)
4132                            , seedC));
4133                    minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, h);
4134                    maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, h);
4135                    if(fresh) {
4136                        minHeight = Math.min(minHeight, h);
4137                        maxHeight = Math.max(maxHeight, h);
4138
4139                        minHeat0 = Math.min(minHeat0, p);
4140                        maxHeat0 = Math.max(maxHeat0, p);
4141
4142                        minWet0 = Math.min(minWet0, temp);
4143                        maxWet0 = Math.max(maxWet0, temp);
4144                    }
4145                }
4146                minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, minHeight);
4147                maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, maxHeight);
4148
4149            }
4150            double  heatDiff = 0.8 / (maxHeat0 - minHeat0),
4151                    wetDiff = 1.0 / (maxWet0 - minWet0),
4152                    hMod,
4153                    halfHeight = (height - 1) * 0.5, i_half = 1.0 / halfHeight;
4154            yPos = startY + i_uh;
4155            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4156            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4157
4158            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
4159                temp = Math.abs(yPos - halfHeight) * i_half;
4160                temp *= (2.4 - temp);
4161                temp = 2.2 - temp;
4162                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
4163                    h = heightData[x][y];
4164                    if(heightCodeData[x][y] == 10000) {
4165                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 1000;
4166                        continue;
4167                    }
4168                    else
4169                        heightCodeData[x][y] = (t = codeHeight(h));
4170                    hMod = 1.0;
4171                    switch (t) {
4172                        case 0:
4173                        case 1:
4174                        case 2:
4175                        case 3:
4176                            h = 0.4;
4177                            hMod = 0.2;
4178                            break;
4179                        case 6:
4180                            h = -0.1 * (h - forestLower - 0.08);
4181                            break;
4182                        case 7:
4183                            h *= -0.25;
4184                            break;
4185                        case 8:
4186                            h *= -0.4;
4187                            break;
4188                        default:
4189                            h *= 0.05;
4190                    }
4191                    heatData[x][y] = (h = (((heatData[x][y] - minHeat0) * heatDiff * hMod) + h + 0.6) * temp);
4192                    if (fresh) {
4193                        ps = Math.min(ps, h); //minHeat0
4194                        pc = Math.max(pc, h); //maxHeat0
4195                    }
4196                }
4197            }
4198            if(fresh)
4199            {
4200                minHeat1 = ps;
4201                maxHeat1 = pc;
4202            }
4203            heatDiff = heatModifier / (maxHeat1 - minHeat1);
4204            qs = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4205            qc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4206            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4207            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4208
4209
4210            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
4211                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
4212                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat1) * heatDiff));
4213                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = (moistureData[x][y] - minWet0) * wetDiff);
4214                    if (fresh) {
4215                        qs = Math.min(qs, h);
4216                        qc = Math.max(qc, h);
4217                        ps = Math.min(ps, temp);
4218                        pc = Math.max(pc, temp);
4219                    }
4220                }
4221            }
4222            if(fresh)
4223            {
4224                minHeat = qs;
4225                maxHeat = qc;
4226                minWet = ps;
4227                maxWet = pc;
4228            }
4229            landData.refill(heightCodeData, 4, 999);
4230        }
4231    }

4235    /**
4236     * A concrete implementation of {@link WorldMapGenerator} that imitates an infinite-distance perspective view of a
4237     * world, showing only one hemisphere, that should be as wide as it is tall (its outline is a circle). It should
4238     * look as a world would when viewed from space, and implements rotation differently to allow the planet to be
4239     * rotated without recalculating all the data, though it cannot zoom. Note that calling
4240     * {@link #setCenterLongitude(double)} does a lot more work than in other classes, but less than fully calling
4241     * {@link #generate()} in those classes, since it doesn't remake the map data at a slightly different rotation and
4242     * instead keeps a single map in use the whole time, using sections of it. This uses an
4243     * <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orthographic_projection_in_cartography">Orthographic projection</a> with
4244     * the latitude always at the equator; the internal map is stored as a {@link SphereMap}, which uses a
4245     * <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cylindrical_equal-area_projection#Discussion">cylindrical equal-area
4246     * projection</a>, specifically the Smyth equal-surface projection.
4247     * <br>
4248     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/WNa5nQ1.gifv">Example view of a planet rotating</a>.
4249     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/NV5IMd6.gifv">Another example</a>.
4250     */
4251    public static class RotatingSpaceMap extends WorldMapGenerator {
4252        protected double minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
4253                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
4254                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4255
4256        public final double[][] xPositions,
4257                yPositions,
4258                zPositions;
4259        protected final int[] edges;
4260        public final SphereMap storedMap;
4261        /**
4262         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
4263         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
4264         * Always makes a 100x100 map.
4265         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4266         * If you were using {@link RotatingSpaceMap#RotatingSpaceMap(long, int, int, Noise3D, double)}, then this would be the
4267         * same as passing the parameters {@code 0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 100, 100, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0}.
4268         */
4269        public RotatingSpaceMap() {
4270            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 100, 100, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
4271        }
4272
4273        /**
4274         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
4275         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
4276         * Takes only the width/height of the map. The initial seed is set to the same large long
4277         * every time, and it's likely that you would set the seed when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and
4278         * height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
4279         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4280         *
4281         * @param mapWidth  the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4282         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4283         */
4284        public RotatingSpaceMap(int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
4285            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, mapWidth, mapHeight, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
4286        }

4289         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,

4292         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
4293         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
4294         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4295         *
4296         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
4297         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later

4299         */
4300        public RotatingSpaceMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {

4309         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.

4330         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later

4338        /**
4339         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to view a spherical world from space,
4340         * showing only one hemisphere at a time.
4341         * Takes an initial seed, the width/height of the map, and parameters for noise
4342         * generation (a {@link Noise3D} implementation, which is usually {@link FastNoise#instance}, and a
4343         * multiplier on how many octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers
4344         * producing even more detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
4345         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
4346         * cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in. FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
4347         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
4348         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
4349         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
4350         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
4351         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
4352         * that don't require zooming.
4353         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
4354         * @param mapWidth the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4355         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4356         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
4357         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
4358         */
4359        public RotatingSpaceMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier) {
4360            super(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight);
4361            xPositions = new double[mapWidth][mapHeight];
4362            yPositions = new double[mapWidth][mapHeight];
4363            zPositions = new double[mapWidth][mapHeight];
4364            edges = new int[height << 1];
4365            storedMap = new SphereMap(initialSeed, mapWidth << 1, mapHeight, noiseGenerator, octaveMultiplier);
4366        }
4367
4368        /**
4369         * Copies the RotatingSpaceMap {@code other} to construct a new one that is exactly the same. References will only
4370         * be shared to Noise classes.
4371         * @param other a RotatingSpaceMap to copy
4372         */
4373        public RotatingSpaceMap(RotatingSpaceMap other)
4374        {
4375            super(other);
4376            minHeat0 = other.minHeat0;
4377            maxHeat0 = other.maxHeat0;
4378            minHeat1 = other.minHeat1;
4379            maxHeat1 = other.maxHeat1;
4380            minWet0 = other.minWet0;
4381            maxWet0 = other.maxWet0;
4382            xPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.xPositions);
4383            yPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.yPositions);
4384            zPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.zPositions);
4385            edges = Arrays.copyOf(other.edges, other.edges.length);
4386            storedMap = new SphereMap(other.storedMap);
4387        }

4390        @Override
4391        public int wrapX(int x, int y) {
4392            y = Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
4393            return Math.max(edges[y << 1], Math.min(x, edges[y << 1 | 1]));
4394        }
4395
4396        @Override
4397        public int wrapY(final int x, final int y)  {
4398            return Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
4399        }
4400
4401        @Override
4402        public void setCenterLongitude(double centerLongitude) {
4403            super.setCenterLongitude(centerLongitude);
4404            int ax, ay;
4405            double
4406                    ps, pc,
4407                    qs, qc,
4408                    h, yPos, xPos, iyPos, ixPos,
4409                    i_uw = usedWidth / (double)width,
4410                    i_uh = usedHeight / (double)height,
4411                    th, lon, lat, rho,
4412                    i_pi = 1.0 / Math.PI,
4413                    rx = width * 0.5, irx = i_uw / rx,
4414                    ry = height * 0.5, iry = i_uh / ry;
4415
4416            yPos = startY - ry;
4417            iyPos = yPos / ry;
4418            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh, iyPos += iry) {
4419                boolean inSpace = true;
4420                xPos = startX - rx;
4421                ixPos = xPos / rx;
4422                lat = NumberTools.asin(iyPos);
4423                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++, xPos += i_uw, ixPos += irx) {
4424                    rho = (ixPos * ixPos + iyPos * iyPos);
4425                    if(rho > 1.0) {
4426                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 1000;
4427                        inSpace = true;
4428                        continue;
4429                    }
4430                    rho = Math.sqrt(rho);
4431                    if(inSpace)
4432                    {
4433                        inSpace = false;
4434                        edges[y << 1] = x;
4435                    }
4436                    edges[y << 1 | 1] = x;
4437                    th = NumberTools.asin(rho); // c
4438                    lon = removeExcess((centerLongitude + (NumberTools.atan2(ixPos * rho, rho * NumberTools.cos(th)))) * 0.5);
4439
4440                    qs = lat * 0.6366197723675814;
4441                    qc = qs + 1.0;
4442                    int sf = (qs >= 0.0 ? (int) qs : (int) qs - 1) & -2;
4443                    int cf = (qc >= 0.0 ? (int) qc : (int) qc - 1) & -2;
4444                    qs -= sf;
4445                    qc -= cf;
4446                    qs *= 2.0 - qs;
4447                    qc *= 2.0 - qc;
4448                    qs = qs * (-0.775 - 0.225 * qs) * ((sf & 2) - 1);
4449                    qc = qc * (-0.775 - 0.225 * qc) * ((cf & 2) - 1);
4450
4451
4452                    ps = lon * 0.6366197723675814;
4453                    pc = ps + 1.0;
4454                    sf = (ps >= 0.0 ? (int) ps : (int) ps - 1) & -2;
4455                    cf = (pc >= 0.0 ? (int) pc : (int) pc - 1) & -2;
4456                    ps -= sf;
4457                    pc -= cf;
4458                    ps *= 2.0 - ps;
4459                    pc *= 2.0 - pc;
4460                    ps = ps * (-0.775 - 0.225 * ps) * ((sf & 2) - 1);
4461                    pc = pc * (-0.775 - 0.225 * pc) * ((cf & 2) - 1);
4462
4463                    ax = (int)((lon * i_pi + 1.0) * width);
4464                    ay = (int)((qs + 1.0) * ry);
4465                    
4466//                    // Hammer projection, not an inverse projection like we usually use
4467//                    z = 1.0 / Math.sqrt(1 + qc * NumberTools.cos(lon * 0.5));
4468//                    ax = (int)((qc * NumberTools.sin(lon * 0.5) * z + 1.0) * width);
4469//                    ay = (int)((qs * z + 1.0) * height * 0.5);
4470
4471                    if(ax >= storedMap.width || ax < 0 || ay >= storedMap.height || ay < 0)
4472                    {
4473                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 1000;
4474                        continue;
4475                    }
4476                    if(storedMap.heightCodeData[ax][ay] >= 1000) // for the seam we get when looping around
4477                    {
4478                        ay = storedMap.wrapY(ax, ay);
4479                        ax = storedMap.wrapX(ax, ay);
4480                    }
4481
4482                    xPositions[x][y] = pc * qc;
4483                    yPositions[x][y] = ps * qc;
4484                    zPositions[x][y] = qs;
4485
4486                    heightData[x][y] = h = storedMap.heightData[ax][ay];
4487                    heightCodeData[x][y] = codeHeight(h);
4488                    heatData[x][y] = storedMap.heatData[ax][ay];
4489                    moistureData[x][y] = storedMap.moistureData[ax][ay];
4490
4491                    minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, h);
4492                    maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, h);
4493                }
4494                minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, minHeight);
4495                maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, maxHeight);
4496            }
4497
4498        }
4499
4500        protected void regenerate(int startX, int startY, int usedWidth, int usedHeight,
4501                                  double landMod, double heatMod, int stateA, int stateB)
4502        {
4503            if(cacheA != stateA || cacheB != stateB)// || landMod != storedMap.landModifier || coolMod != storedMap.coolingModifier)
4504            {
4505                storedMap.regenerate(0, 0, width << 1, height, landMod, heatMod, stateA, stateB);
4506                minHeightActual = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4507                maxHeightActual = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4508
4509                minHeight = storedMap.minHeight;
4510                maxHeight = storedMap.maxHeight;
4511
4512                minHeat0 = storedMap.minHeat0;
4513                maxHeat0 = storedMap.maxHeat0;
4514
4515                minHeat1 = storedMap.minHeat1;
4516                maxHeat1 = storedMap.maxHeat1;
4517
4518                minWet0 = storedMap.minWet0;
4519                maxWet0 = storedMap.maxWet0;
4520
4521                minHeat = storedMap.minHeat;
4522                maxHeat = storedMap.maxHeat;
4523
4524                minWet = storedMap.minWet;
4525                maxWet = storedMap.maxWet;
4526
4527                cacheA = stateA;
4528                cacheB = stateB;
4529            }
4530            setCenterLongitude(centerLongitude);
4531            landData.refill(heightCodeData, 4, 999);
4532        }
4533    }
4534    /**
4535     * A concrete implementation of {@link WorldMapGenerator} that does no projection of the map, as if the area were
4536     * completely flat or small enough that curvature is impossible to see. This also does not change heat levels at the
4537     * far north and south regions of the map, since it is meant for areas that are all about the same heat level.
4538     * <a href="http://yellowstonegames.github.io/SquidLib/LocalMap.png" >Example map, showing lack of polar ice</a>
4539     */
4540    public static class LocalMap extends WorldMapGenerator {
4541        protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.45, terrainRidgedFreq = 2.6, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375;
4542        //protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.65, terrainRidgedFreq = 1.8, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375, riverRidgedFreq = 21.7;
4543        protected double minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
4544                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
4545                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4546
4547        public final Noise.Maelstrom2D terrain, otherRidged;
4548        public final Noise.InverseLayered2D heat, moisture, terrainLayered;
4549        public final double[][] xPositions,
4550                yPositions,
4551                zPositions;
4552

4555         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to wrap a sphere (as with a texture on a
4556         * 3D model), with seamless east-west wrapping, no north-south wrapping, and distortion that causes the poles to
4557         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
4558         * Always makes a 256x128 map.
4559         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4560         * If you were using {@link LocalMap#LocalMap(long, int, int, Noise2D, double)}, then this would be the
4561         * same as passing the parameters {@code 0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 256, 128, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0}.
4562         */
4563        public LocalMap() {
4564            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 256, 128, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
4565        }

4570         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
4571         * Takes only the width/height of the map. The initial seed is set to the same large long
4572         * every time, and it's likely that you would set the seed when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and
4573         * height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
4574         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.

4577         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4578         */
4579        public LocalMap(int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
4580            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, mapWidth, mapHeight,  DEFAULT_NOISE,1.0);
4581        }

4586         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.

4588         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.

4603         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
4604         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
4605         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.

4608         *

4610         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4611         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4612         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal

4621         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
4622         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
4623         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
4624         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
4625         * Uses the given noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4626         *

4628         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
