4636        /**
4637         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to wrap a sphere (as with a texture on a
4638         * 3D model), with seamless east-west wrapping, no north-south wrapping, and distortion that causes the poles to
4639         * have significantly-exaggerated-in-size features while the equator is not distorted.
4640         * Takes an initial seed, the width/height of the map, and parameters for noise
4641         * generation (a {@link Noise3D} implementation, which is usually {@link FastNoise#instance}, and a
4642         * multiplier on how many octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers
4643         * producing even more detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
4644         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
4645         * cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in. FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
4646         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
4647         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
4648         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
4649         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
4650         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
4651         * that don't require zooming.
4652         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
4653         * @param mapWidth the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4654         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
4655         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise#instance}
4656         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
4657         */
4658        public LocalMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise2D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier) {
4659            super(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight);
4660            xPositions = new double[width][height];
4661            yPositions = new double[width][height];
4662            zPositions = new double[width][height];
4663
4664            terrain = new Noise.Maelstrom2D(new Noise.Ridged2D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 10), terrainFreq));
4665            terrainLayered = new Noise.InverseLayered2D(noiseGenerator, (int) (1 + octaveMultiplier * 6), terrainRidgedFreq * 0.325);
4666            heat = new Noise.InverseLayered2D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 3), heatFreq, 0.75);
4667            moisture = new Noise.InverseLayered2D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 4), moistureFreq, 0.55);
4668            otherRidged = new Noise.Maelstrom2D(new Noise.Ridged2D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 6), otherFreq));
4669        }

4677        {

4691            yPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.yPositions);

4696        public int wrapX(final int x, final int y)  {
4697            return Math.max(0, Math.min(x, width - 1));

4701        public int wrapY(final int x, final int y)  {
4702            return Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
4703        }
4704        
4705        protected void regenerate(int startX, int startY, int usedWidth, int usedHeight,
4706                                  double landMod, double heatMod, int stateA, int stateB)
4707        {
4708            boolean fresh = false;
4709            if(cacheA != stateA || cacheB != stateB || landMod != landModifier || heatMod != heatModifier)
4710            {
4711                minHeight = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4712                maxHeight = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4713                minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4714                maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4715                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4716                maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4717                minHeat = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4718                maxHeat = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4719                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4720                maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4721                minWet = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4722                maxWet = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4723                cacheA = stateA;
4724                cacheB = stateB;
4725                fresh = true;
4726            }
4727            rng.setState(stateA, stateB);
4728            long seedA = rng.nextLong(), seedB = rng.nextLong(), seedC = rng.nextLong();
4729            int t;
4730
4731            landModifier = (landMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.29) + 0.91 : landMod;
4732            heatModifier = (heatMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.45) * (rng.nextDouble()-0.5) + 1.1 : heatMod;
4733
4734            double p,
4735                    ps, pc,
4736                    qs, qc,
4737                    h, temp,
4738                    i_w = 1.0 / width, i_h = 1.0 / (height),  ii = Math.max(i_w, i_h),
4739                    i_uw = usedWidth * i_w * ii, i_uh = usedHeight * i_h * ii, xPos, yPos = startY * i_h;
4740            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) { 
4741                xPos = startX * i_w;
4742                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++, xPos += i_uw) {
4743                    xPositions[x][y] = xPos;
4744                    yPositions[x][y] = yPos;
4745                    zPositions[x][y] = 0.0;
4746                    heightData[x][y] = (h = terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos +
4747                                    terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos, yPos, seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
4748                            yPos, seedA) + landModifier - 1.0);
4749                    heatData[x][y] = (p = heat.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos, yPos
4750                                    + 0.375 * otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos, yPos, seedB + seedC),
4751                            seedB));
4752                    temp = 0.375 * otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos, yPos, seedC + seedA);
4753                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = moisture.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos - temp, yPos + temp, seedC));
4754
4755                    minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, h);
4756                    maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, h);
4757                    if(fresh) {
4758                        minHeight = Math.min(minHeight, h);
4759                        maxHeight = Math.max(maxHeight, h);
4760
4761                        minHeat0 = Math.min(minHeat0, p);
4762                        maxHeat0 = Math.max(maxHeat0, p);
4763
4764                        minWet0 = Math.min(minWet0, temp);
4765                        maxWet0 = Math.max(maxWet0, temp);
4766                    }
4767                }
4768                minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, minHeight);
4769                maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, maxHeight);
4770
4771            }
4772            double  heatDiff = 0.8 / (maxHeat0 - minHeat0),
4773                    wetDiff = 1.0 / (maxWet0 - minWet0),
4774                    hMod;
4775            yPos = startY * i_h + i_uh;
4776            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4777            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4778
4779            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
4780                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
4781                    h = heightData[x][y];
4782                    heightCodeData[x][y] = (t = codeHeight(h));
4783                    hMod = 1.0;
4784                    switch (t) {
4785                        case 0:
4786                        case 1:
4787                        case 2:
4788                        case 3:
4789                            h = 0.4;
4790                            hMod = 0.2;
4791                            break;
4792                        case 6:
4793                            h = -0.1 * (h - forestLower - 0.08);
4794                            break;
4795                        case 7:
4796                            h *= -0.25;
4797                            break;
4798                        case 8:
4799                            h *= -0.4;
4800                            break;
4801                        default:
4802                            h *= 0.05;
4803                    }
4804                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat0) * heatDiff * hMod) + h + 0.6);
4805                    if (fresh) {
4806                        ps = Math.min(ps, h); //minHeat0
4807                        pc = Math.max(pc, h); //maxHeat0
4808                    }
4809                }
4810            }
4811            if(fresh)
4812            {
4813                minHeat1 = ps;
4814                maxHeat1 = pc;
4815            }
4816            heatDiff = heatModifier / (maxHeat1 - minHeat1);
4817            qs = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4818            qc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4819            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
4820            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
4821
4822
4823            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
4824                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
4825                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat1) * heatDiff));
4826                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = (moistureData[x][y] - minWet0) * wetDiff);
4827                    if (fresh) {
4828                        qs = Math.min(qs, h);
4829                        qc = Math.max(qc, h);
4830                        ps = Math.min(ps, temp);
4831                        pc = Math.max(pc, temp);
4832                    }
4833                }
4834            }
4835            if(fresh)
4836            {
4837                minHeat = qs;
4838                maxHeat = qc;
4839                minWet = ps;
4840                maxWet = pc;
4841            }
4842            landData.refill(heightCodeData, 4, 999);
4843        }
4844    }

4846    /**
4847     * An unusual map generator that imitates an existing local map (such as a map of Australia, which it can do by
4848     * default), without applying any projection or changing heat levels in the polar regions or equator.
4849     * <a href="http://yellowstonegames.github.io/SquidLib/LocalMimicMap.png" >Example map, showing a variant on Australia</a>
4850     */
4851    public static class LocalMimicMap extends LocalMap
4852    {
4853        public GreasedRegion earth;
4854        public GreasedRegion shallow;
4855        public GreasedRegion coast;
4856        public GreasedRegion earthOriginal;
4857        /**
4858         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that should look like Australia, without projecting the
4859         * land positions or changing heat by latitude. Always makes a 256x256 map.
4860         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4861         * If you were using {@link LocalMimicMap#LocalMimicMap(long, Noise2D, double)}, then this would be the
4862         * same as passing the parameters {@code 0x1337BABE1337D00DL, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0}.
4863         */
4864        public LocalMimicMap() {
4865            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL
4866                    , DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
4867        }

4869        /**
4870         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that should have land in roughly the same places as the
4871         * given GreasedRegion's "on" cells, without projecting the land positions or changing heat by latitude.
4872         * The initial seed is set to the same large long every time, and it's likely that you would set the seed when
4873         * you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact.
4874         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4875         *
4876         * @param toMimic the world map to imitate, as a GreasedRegion with land as "on"; the height and width will be copied
4877         */
4878        public LocalMimicMap(GreasedRegion toMimic) {
4879            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, toMimic,  DEFAULT_NOISE,1.0);

4884         * given GreasedRegion's "on" cells, without projecting the land positions or changing heat by latitude.
4885         * Takes an initial seed and the GreasedRegion containing land positions. The {@code initialSeed}
4886         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
4887         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact.
4888         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4889         *

4897        /**
4898         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that should have land in roughly the same places as the
4899         * given GreasedRegion's "on" cells, without projecting the land positions or changing heat by latitude.
4900         * Takes an initial seed, the GreasedRegion containing land positions, and a multiplier that affects the level
4901         * of detail by increasing or decreasing the number of octaves of noise used. The {@code initialSeed}
4902         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
4903         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact.
4904         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with the given octave multiplier affecting detail.
4905         *
4906         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
4907         * @param toMimic the world map to imitate, as a GreasedRegion with land as "on"; the height and width will be copied
4908         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
4909         */
4910        public LocalMimicMap(long initialSeed, GreasedRegion toMimic, double octaveMultiplier) {
4911            this(initialSeed, toMimic, DEFAULT_NOISE, octaveMultiplier);

4914        /**
4915         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that should have land in roughly the same places as the
4916         * given GreasedRegion's "on" cells, without projecting the land positions or changing heat by latitude.
4917         * Takes an initial seed, the GreasedRegion containing land positions, and parameters for noise generation (a
4918         * {@link Noise3D} implementation, which is usually {@link FastNoise#instance}. The {@code initialSeed}
4919         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call
4920         * {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact. Both FastNoise
4921         * and FastNoise make sense to use for {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter
4922         * because this will change the seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static
4923         * {@link FastNoise#instance} or {@link FastNoise#instance} because they have no changing state between runs
4924         * of the program). Uses the given noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
4925         *
4926         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
4927         * @param toMimic the world map to imitate, as a GreasedRegion with land as "on"; the height and width will be copied
4928         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise} or {@link FastNoise}
4929         */
4930        public LocalMimicMap(long initialSeed, GreasedRegion toMimic, Noise2D noiseGenerator) {

4932        }

4934        /**
4935         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that should have land in roughly the same places as the
4936         * given GreasedRegion's "on" cells, using an elliptical projection (specifically, a Mollweide projection).
4937         * Takes an initial seed, the GreasedRegion containing land positions, parameters for noise generation (a
4938         * {@link Noise3D} implementation, which is usually {@link FastNoise#instance}, and a multiplier on how many
4939         * octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers producing even more
4940         * detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
4941         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
4942         * cannot be changed after the fact.  FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
4943         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
4944         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
4945         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
4946         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
4947         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
4948         * that don't require zooming.
4949         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
4950         * @param toMimic the world map to imitate, as a GreasedRegion with land as "on"; the height and width will be copied
4951         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise} or {@link FastNoise}
4952         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
4953         */
4954        public LocalMimicMap(long initialSeed, GreasedRegion toMimic, Noise2D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier) {
4955            super(initialSeed, toMimic.width, toMimic.height, noiseGenerator, octaveMultiplier);
4956            earth = toMimic;
4957            earthOriginal = earth.copy();
4958            coast   = earth.copy().not().fringe(2);
4959            shallow = earth.copy().fringe(2);
4960        }
4961        /**
4962         * Stores a 256x256 GreasedRegion that shows an unprojected map of Australia, in a format that can be read back
4963         * with {@link GreasedRegion#decompress(String)}. By using GreasedRegion's compression, this takes up a lot less
4964         * room than it would with most text-based formats, and even beats uncompressed binary storage of the map by a
4965         * factor of 9.4. The map data won't change here, so this should stay compatible.
4966         */
4967        public static final String AUSTRALIA_ENCODED = "Ƥ䒅⒐᮰囨䈢ħ䐤࠰ࠨ•Ⱙအ䎢ŘňÆ䴣ȢؤF䭠゠ᔤ∠偰ഀ\u0560₠ኼܨā᭮笁\u242AЦᇅ扰रࠦ吠䠪ࠦ䠧娮⠬䠬❁Ềក\u1CAA͠敠ἒ慽Ê䄄洡儠䋻䨡㈠䙬坈མŨྈ䞻䛊哚晪⁞倰h·䡂Ļæ抂㴢္\u082E搧䈠ᇩᒠ᩠ɀ༨ʨڤʃ奲ࢠ፠ᆙả䝆䮳りĩ(ॠી᧰྄e॑ᤙ䒠剠⁌ဥࠩФΝ䂂⢴ᑠ㺀ᢣ䗨dBqÚ扜冢\u0FE5\u0A62䐠劣ေ¯䂍䞀ၰ\u0E67ᐓ〈ᄠ塠Ѡ̀ာ⠤ᡤŒęጓ憒‱〿䌳℔ᐼ䊢⁚䤿ӣ◚㙀\u0C74Ӹ抠⣀ĨǊǸ䁃း₺Ý䂁ᜤ䢑V⁄樫焠\u0A60\u2E78⎲Ĉ䁎勯戡璠悈ᠥ嘡⩩‰ನ檨㡕䶪၁@恑ࠣ䘣ࢠᅀᡎ劰桠Өॢಸ熛փࢸ䀹ఽ䅠勖ਰ۴̄ጺಢ䈠ᙠᨭ\u2FE0焠Ӡܼ䇂䒠ᯀԨĠ愜᪅䦥㶐ୀ\u09C5Ƣ*䂕ॹ∠咠р\u0604У無~⁆Г椠痠\u1CA9Ⱓס㩖ᝋ司楠२ญⳘ䬣汤ǿã㱩ᖷ掠Àݒ㑁c‾䮴,\u2452僢ᰣ缠ɋ乨\u0378䁡绑ס傓䁔瀾ሺÑ䀤ो刡开烀\u0A76Ё䈠䈰״Áj⁑䠡戢碠㘀አ䃉㪙嘈ʂø⸪௰₈㐲暤ƩDᬿ䂖剙書\u0FE0㴢\u0089㘩Ĉ䰵掀栰杁4〡Ƞ⭀\u1AE0㠰㹨Zコത\u009E䂖ࠠⴠ縣吠ᆠʡ㡀䀧否䣝Ӧ愠Ⓚ\u1CA2ಠո*①ӈԥ獀խ@㟬箬㐱\u31BE簽Ɛᩆᇞ稯禚⟶⣑аβǚ㥎Ḇ⌢㑆 搡⁗ဣ刣\u0C45䑒8怺₵⤦a5ਵ㏰ᩄ猢ฦ䬞㐷䈠呠カ愠ۀ\u1C92傠ᅼ߃ᙊ䢨ၠླྀš亀ƴ̰刷ʼ墨愠  ";
4968
4969        /**
4970         * Constructs a 256x256 unprojected local map that will use land forms with a similar shape to Australia.

4972         * @param noiseGenerator
4973         * @param octaveMultiplier
4974         */
4975        public LocalMimicMap(long initialSeed, Noise2D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier)
4976        {

4978                    GreasedRegion.decompress(AUSTRALIA_ENCODED), noiseGenerator, octaveMultiplier);

4981        /**
4982         * Copies the LocalMimicMap {@code other} to construct a new one that is exactly the same. References will only
4983         * be shared to Noise classes.
4984         * @param other a LocalMimicMap to copy
4985         */
4986        public LocalMimicMap(LocalMimicMap other)
4987        {
4988            super(other);
4989            earth = other.earth.copy();
4990            earthOriginal = other.earthOriginal.copy();
4991            coast   = other.coast.copy();
4992            shallow = other.shallow.copy();
4993        }

4996
4997        protected void regenerate(int startX, int startY, int usedWidth, int usedHeight,
4998                                  double landMod, double heatMod, int stateA, int stateB)
4999        {
5000            boolean fresh = false;
5001            if(cacheA != stateA || cacheB != stateB || landMod != landModifier || heatMod != heatModifier)
5002            {
5003                minHeight = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
5004                maxHeight = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
5005                minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
5006                maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
5007                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
5008                maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
5009                minHeat = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
5010                maxHeat = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
5011                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
5012                maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
5013                minWet = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
5014                maxWet = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
5015                cacheA = stateA;
5016                cacheB = stateB;
5017                fresh = true;
5018            }
5019            rng.setState(stateA, stateB);
5020            long seedA = rng.nextLong(), seedB = rng.nextLong(), seedC = rng.nextLong();
5021            int t;
5022
5023            landModifier = (landMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.29) + 0.91 : landMod;
5024            heatModifier = (heatMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.45) * (rng.nextDouble()-0.5) + 1.1 : heatMod;
5025
5026            earth.remake(earthOriginal);
5027
5028            if(zoom > 0)
5029            {
5030                int stx = Math.min(Math.max((zoomStartX - (width  >> 1)) / ((2 << zoom) - 2), 0), width ),
5031                        sty = Math.min(Math.max((zoomStartY - (height >> 1)) / ((2 << zoom) - 2), 0), height);
5032                for (int z = 0; z < zoom; z++) {
5033                    earth.zoom(stx, sty).expand8way().fray(0.5).expand();
5034                }
5035                coast.remake(earth).not().fringe(2 << zoom).expand().fray(0.5);
5036                shallow.remake(earth).fringe(2 << zoom).expand().fray(0.5);
5037            }
5038            else
5039            {
5040                coast.remake(earth).not().fringe(2);
5041                shallow.remake(earth).fringe(2);
5042            }
5043            double p,
5044                    ps, pc,
5045                    qs, qc,
5046                    h, temp,
5047                    i_w = 1.0 / width, i_h = 1.0 / (height),
5048                    i_uw = usedWidth * i_w * i_w, i_uh = usedHeight * i_h * i_h, xPos, yPos = startY * i_h;
5049            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
5050                xPos = startX * i_w;
5051                for (int x = 0, xt = 0; x < width; x++, xPos += i_uw) {
5052                    xPositions[x][y] = (xPos - .5) * 2.0;
5053                    yPositions[x][y] = (yPos - .5) * 2.0;
5054                    zPositions[x][y] = 0.0;
5055
5056                    if(earth.contains(x, y))
5057                    {
5058                        h = NumberTools.swayTight(terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos +
5059                                        terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos, yPos, seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
5060                                yPos, seedA)) * 0.85;
5061                        if(coast.contains(x, y))
5062                            h += 0.05;
5063                        else
5064                            h += 0.15;
5065                    }
5066                    else
5067                    {
5068                        h = NumberTools.swayTight(terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos +
5069                                        terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos, yPos, seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
5070                                yPos, seedA)) * -0.9;
5071                        if(shallow.contains(x, y))
5072                            h = (h - 0.08) * 0.375;
5073                        else
5074                            h = (h - 0.125) * 0.75;
5075                    }
5076                    //h += landModifier - 1.0;
5077                    heightData[x][y] = h;
5078                    heatData[x][y] = (p = heat.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos, yPos
5079                                    + 0.375 * otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos, yPos, seedB + seedC),
5080                            seedB));
5081                    temp = 0.375 * otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos, yPos, seedC + seedA);
5082                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = moisture.getNoiseWithSeed(xPos - temp, yPos + temp, seedC));
5083
5084                    minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, h);
5085                    maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, h);
5086                    if(fresh) {
5087                        minHeight = Math.min(minHeight, h);
5088                        maxHeight = Math.max(maxHeight, h);
5089
5090                        minHeat0 = Math.min(minHeat0, p);
5091                        maxHeat0 = Math.max(maxHeat0, p);
5092
5093                        minWet0 = Math.min(minWet0, temp);
5094                        maxWet0 = Math.max(maxWet0, temp);
5095                    }
5096                }
5097                minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, minHeight);
5098                maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, maxHeight);
5099
5100            }
5101            double  heatDiff = 0.8 / (maxHeat0 - minHeat0),
5102                    wetDiff = 1.0 / (maxWet0 - minWet0),
5103                    hMod;
5104            yPos = startY * i_h + i_uh;
5105            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
5106            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
5107
5108            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
5109                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
5110                    h = heightData[x][y];
5111                    heightCodeData[x][y] = (t = codeHeight(h));
5112                    hMod = 1.0;
5113                    switch (t) {
5114                        case 0:
5115                        case 1:
5116                        case 2:
5117                        case 3:
5118                            h = 0.4;
5119                            hMod = 0.2;
5120                            break;
5121                        case 6:
5122                            h = -0.1 * (h - forestLower - 0.08);
5123                            break;
5124                        case 7:
5125                            h *= -0.25;
5126                            break;
5127                        case 8:
5128                            h *= -0.4;
5129                            break;
5130                        default:
5131                            h *= 0.05;
5132                    }
5133                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat0) * heatDiff * hMod) + h + 0.6);
5134                    if (fresh) {
5135                        ps = Math.min(ps, h); //minHeat0
5136                        pc = Math.max(pc, h); //maxHeat0
5137                    }
5138                }
5139            }
5140            if(fresh)
5141            {
5142                minHeat1 = ps;
5143                maxHeat1 = pc;
5144            }
5145            heatDiff = heatModifier / (maxHeat1 - minHeat1);
5146            qs = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
5147            qc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
5148            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
5149            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
5150
5151
5152            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
5153                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
5154                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat1) * heatDiff));
5155                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = (moistureData[x][y] - minWet0) * wetDiff);
5156                    if (fresh) {
5157                        qs = Math.min(qs, h);
5158                        qc = Math.max(qc, h);
5159                        ps = Math.min(ps, temp);
5160                        pc = Math.max(pc, temp);
5161                    }
5162                }
5163            }
5164            if(fresh)
5165            {
5166                minHeat = qs;
5167                maxHeat = qc;
5168                minWet = ps;
5169                maxWet = pc;
5170            }
5171            landData.refill(heightCodeData, 4, 999);
5172        }
5173    }

5175    /**
5176     * A modified version of the Eckert II projection, shaped like an elongated hexagon. This tries to keep the angles
5177     * of a regular hexagon, so it could be used for a map with a hexagonal grid; Eckert II uses different angles from
5178     * a regular hexagon. It looks good when its width is roughly twice its height; an 8:5 ratio seems even better.
5179     */
5180    @Beta
5181    public static class HexagonalMap extends WorldMapGenerator {
5182        //        protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.35, terrainRidgedFreq = 1.8, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375, riverRidgedFreq = 21.7;
5183        protected static final double terrainFreq = 1.45, terrainRidgedFreq = 2.6, heatFreq = 2.1, moistureFreq = 2.125, otherFreq = 3.375;
5184        protected double minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
5185                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY,
5186                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
5187
5188        public final Noise3D terrain, heat, moisture, otherRidged, terrainLayered;
5189        public final double[][] xPositions,
5190                yPositions,
5191                zPositions;
5192        protected final int[] edges;
5193
5194
5195        /**
5196         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
5197         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
5198         * Always makes a 200x100 map.
5199         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail.
5200         * If you were using {@link HexagonalMap#HexagonalMap(long, int, int, Noise3D, double)}, then this would be the
5201         * same as passing the parameters {@code 0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 200, 100, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0}.
5202         */
5203        public HexagonalMap() {
5204            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, 200, 100, DEFAULT_NOISE, 1.0);
5205        }

5207        /**
5208         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
5209         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
5210         * Takes only the width/height of the map. The initial seed is set to the same large long
5211         * every time, and it's likely that you would set the seed when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and
5212         * height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.

5217         */
5218        public HexagonalMap(int mapWidth, int mapHeight) {
5219            this(0x1337BABE1337D00DL, mapWidth, mapHeight,  DEFAULT_NOISE,1.0);

5243         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
5244         * Uses FastNoise as its noise generator, with the given octave multiplier affecting detail.
5245         *
5246         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
5247         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
5248         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
5249         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal

5255        /**
5256         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
5257         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
5258         * Takes an initial seed and the width/height of the map. The {@code initialSeed}
5259         * parameter may or may not be used, since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}.
5260         * The width and height of the map cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in.
5261         * Uses the given noise generator, with 1.0 as the octave multiplier affecting detail. The suggested Noise3D
5262         * implementation to use is {@link FastNoise#instance}
5263         *
5264         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
5265         * @param mapWidth    the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
5266         * @param mapHeight   the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
5267         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
5268         */
5269        public HexagonalMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator) {
5270            this(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight, noiseGenerator, 1.0);
5271        }
5272
5273        /**
5274         * Constructs a concrete WorldMapGenerator for a map that can be used to display a projection of a globe onto an
5275         * ellipse without distortion of the sizes of features but with significant distortion of shape.
5276         * Takes an initial seed, the width/height of the map, and parameters for noise generation (a
5277         * {@link Noise3D} implementation, where {@link FastNoise#instance} is suggested, and a
5278         * multiplier on how many octaves of noise to use, with 1.0 being normal (high) detail and higher multipliers
5279         * producing even more detailed noise when zoomed-in). The {@code initialSeed} parameter may or may not be used,
5280         * since you can specify the seed to use when you call {@link #generate(long)}. The width and height of the map
5281         * cannot be changed after the fact, but you can zoom in. FastNoise will be the fastest 3D generator to use for
5282         * {@code noiseGenerator}, and the seed it's constructed with doesn't matter because this will change the
5283         * seed several times at different scales of noise (it's fine to use the static {@link FastNoise#instance}
5284         * because it has no changing state between runs of the program). The {@code octaveMultiplier} parameter should
5285         * probably be no lower than 0.5, but can be arbitrarily high if you're willing to spend much more time on
5286         * generating detail only noticeable at very high zoom; normally 1.0 is fine and may even be too high for maps
5287         * that don't require zooming.
5288         * @param initialSeed the seed for the GWTRNG this uses; this may also be set per-call to generate
5289         * @param mapWidth the width of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
5290         * @param mapHeight the height of the map(s) to generate; cannot be changed later
5291         * @param noiseGenerator an instance of a noise generator capable of 3D noise, usually {@link FastNoise}
5292         * @param octaveMultiplier used to adjust the level of detail, with 0.5 at the bare-minimum detail and 1.0 normal
5293         */
5294        public HexagonalMap(long initialSeed, int mapWidth, int mapHeight, Noise3D noiseGenerator, double octaveMultiplier) {
5295            super(initialSeed, mapWidth, mapHeight);
5296            xPositions = new double[width][height];
5297            yPositions = new double[width][height];
5298            zPositions = new double[width][height];
5299            edges = new int[height << 1];
5300            terrain = new Noise.Maelstrom3D(new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 10), terrainFreq));
5301            terrainLayered = new Noise.Scaled3D(noiseGenerator,  terrainRidgedFreq * 0.325);
5302            heat = new Noise.Scaled3D(noiseGenerator,  heatFreq);
5303            moisture = new Noise.Scaled3D(noiseGenerator,  moistureFreq);
5304            otherRidged = new Noise.Maelstrom3D(new Noise.Ridged3D(noiseGenerator, (int) (0.5 + octaveMultiplier * 6), otherFreq));
5305        }
5306
5307        /**
5308         * Copies the HexagonalMap {@code other} to construct a new one that is exactly the same. References will only
5309         * be shared to Noise classes.
5310         * @param other a HexagonalMap to copy
5311         */
5312        public HexagonalMap(HexagonalMap other)
5313        {
5314            super(other);
5315            terrain = other.terrain;
5316            terrainLayered = other.terrainLayered;
5317            heat = other.heat;
5318            moisture = other.moisture;
5319            otherRidged = other.otherRidged;
5320            minHeat0 = other.minHeat0;
5321            maxHeat0 = other.maxHeat0;
5322            minHeat1 = other.minHeat1;
5323            maxHeat1 = other.maxHeat1;
5324            minWet0 = other.minWet0;
5325            maxWet0 = other.maxWet0;
5326            xPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.xPositions);
5327            yPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.yPositions);
5328            zPositions = ArrayTools.copy(other.zPositions);
5329            edges = Arrays.copyOf(other.edges, other.edges.length);
5330        }
5331
5332        @Override
5333        public int wrapX(final int x, int y) {
5334            y = Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
5335            if(x < edges[y << 1])
5336                return edges[y << 1 | 1];
5337            else if(x > edges[y << 1 | 1])
5338                return edges[y << 1];
5339            else return x;
5340        }
5341
5342        @Override
5343        public int wrapY(final int x, final int y)  {
5344            return Math.max(0, Math.min(y, height - 1));
5345        }
5346
5347        protected void regenerate(int startX, int startY, int usedWidth, int usedHeight,
5348                                  double landMod, double heatMod, int stateA, int stateB)
5349        {
5350            boolean fresh = false;
5351            if(cacheA != stateA || cacheB != stateB || landMod != landModifier || heatMod != heatModifier)
5352            {
5353                minHeight = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
5354                maxHeight = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
5355                minHeightActual = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
5356                maxHeightActual = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
5357                minHeat0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
5358                maxHeat0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
5359                minHeat1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
5360                maxHeat1 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
5361                minHeat = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
5362                maxHeat = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
5363                minWet0 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
5364                maxWet0 = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
5365                minWet = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
5366                maxWet = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
5367                cacheA = stateA;
5368                cacheB = stateB;
5369                fresh = true;
5370            }
5371            rng.setState(stateA, stateB);
5372            long seedA = rng.nextLong(), seedB = rng.nextLong(), seedC = rng.nextLong();
5373            int t;
5374
5375            landModifier = (landMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.2) + 0.91 : landMod;
5376            heatModifier = (heatMod <= 0) ? rng.nextDouble(0.45) * (rng.nextDouble()-0.5) + 1.1 : heatMod;
5377
5378            double p,
5379                    ps, pc,
5380                    qs, qc,
5381                    h, temp, yPos, xPos,
5382                    i_uw = usedWidth / (double)width,
5383                    i_uh = usedHeight / (double)height,
5384                    th, thb, thx, thy, lon, lat,
5385                    rx = width * 0.25, irx = 1.5 / rx, hw = width * 0.5,
5386                    ry = height * 0.5, iry = 1.0 / ry;
5387
5388            yPos = startY - ry;
5389            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
5390                thy = yPos * iry;
5391                thb = 2 - Math.abs(thy) / 1.4472025091165353;
5392                thx = 2 - Math.abs(thy) * (0.75 / 1.4472025091165353);
5393                //1.4472025091165353 == Math.sqrt(2 * 3.14159265358979323846 / 3);
5394                lon = 4.3416075273496055 / (thx + thx);
5395                //4.3416075273496055 == Math.sqrt(6.0 * 3.14159265358979323846)
5396                qs = Math.signum(thy) * (4.0 - thb * thb) * (1.0 / 3.0);
5397                lat = NumberTools.asin(qs);
5398
5399                qc = NumberTools.cos(lat);
5400
5401                boolean inSpace = true;
5402                xPos = startX - hw;
5403                for (int x = 0/*, xt = 0*/; x < width; x++, xPos += i_uw) {
5404                    th = lon * xPos * irx;
5405                    if(th < -3.141592653589793 || th > 3.141592653589793) {
5406                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 10000;
5407                        inSpace = true;
5408                        continue;
5409                    }
5410                    if(inSpace)
5411                    {
5412                        inSpace = false;
5413                        edges[y << 1] = x;
5414                    }
5415                    edges[y << 1 | 1] = x;
5416                    th += centerLongitude;
5417                    ps = NumberTools.sin(th) * qc;
5418                    pc = NumberTools.cos(th) * qc;
5419                    xPositions[x][y] = pc;
5420                    yPositions[x][y] = ps;
5421                    zPositions[x][y] = qs;
5422                    heightData[x][y] = (h = terrainLayered.getNoiseWithSeed(pc +
5423                                    terrain.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB - seedA) * 0.5,
5424                            ps, qs, seedA) + landModifier - 1.0);
5425                    heatData[x][y] = (p = heat.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps
5426                                    + 0.375 * otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs,seedB + seedC)
5427                            , qs, seedB));
5428                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = moisture.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs
5429                                    + 0.375 * otherRidged.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qs, seedC + seedA)
5430                            , seedC));
5431                    minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, h);
5432                    maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, h);
5433                    if(fresh) {
5434                        minHeight = Math.min(minHeight, h);
5435                        maxHeight = Math.max(maxHeight, h);
5436
5437                        minHeat0 = Math.min(minHeat0, p);
5438                        maxHeat0 = Math.max(maxHeat0, p);
5439
5440                        minWet0 = Math.min(minWet0, temp);
5441                        maxWet0 = Math.max(maxWet0, temp);
5442                    }
5443                }
5444                minHeightActual = Math.min(minHeightActual, minHeight);
5445                maxHeightActual = Math.max(maxHeightActual, maxHeight);
5446
5447            }
5448            double  heatDiff = 0.8 / (maxHeat0 - minHeat0),
5449                    wetDiff = 1.0 / (maxWet0 - minWet0),
5450                    hMod,
5451                    halfHeight = (height - 1) * 0.5, i_half = 1.0 / halfHeight;
5452            yPos = startY + i_uh;
5453            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
5454            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
5455
5456            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++, yPos += i_uh) {
5457                temp = Math.abs(yPos - halfHeight) * i_half;
5458                temp *= (2.4 - temp);
5459                temp = 2.2 - temp;
5460                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
5461                    h = heightData[x][y];
5462                    if(heightCodeData[x][y] == 10000) {
5463                        heightCodeData[x][y] = 1000;
5464                        continue;
5465                    }
5466                    else
5467                        heightCodeData[x][y] = (t = codeHeight(h));
5468                    hMod = 1.0;
5469                    switch (t) {
5470                        case 0:
5471                        case 1:
5472                        case 2:
5473                        case 3:
5474                            h = 0.4;
5475                            hMod = 0.2;
5476                            break;
5477                        case 6:
5478                            h = -0.1 * (h - forestLower - 0.08);
5479                            break;
5480                        case 7:
5481                            h *= -0.25;
5482                            break;
5483                        case 8:
5484                            h *= -0.4;
5485                            break;
5486                        default:
5487                            h *= 0.05;
5488                    }
5489                    heatData[x][y] = (h = (((heatData[x][y] - minHeat0) * heatDiff * hMod) + h + 0.6) * temp);
5490                    if (fresh) {
5491                        ps = Math.min(ps, h); //minHeat0
5492                        pc = Math.max(pc, h); //maxHeat0
5493                    }
5494                }
5495            }
5496            if(fresh)
5497            {
5498                minHeat1 = ps;
5499                maxHeat1 = pc;
5500            }
5501            heatDiff = heatModifier / (maxHeat1 - minHeat1);
5502            qs = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
5503            qc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
5504            ps = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
5505            pc = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
5506
5507
5508            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
5509                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
5510                    heatData[x][y] = (h = ((heatData[x][y] - minHeat1) * heatDiff));
5511                    moistureData[x][y] = (temp = (moistureData[x][y] - minWet0) * wetDiff);
5512                    if (fresh) {
5513                        qs = Math.min(qs, h);
5514                        qc = Math.max(qc, h);
5515                        ps = Math.min(ps, temp);
5516                        pc = Math.max(pc, temp);
5517                    }
5518                }
5519            }
5520            if(fresh)
5521            {
5522                minHeat = qs;
5523                maxHeat = qc;
5524                minWet = ps;
5525                maxWet = pc;
5526            }
5527            landData.refill(heightCodeData, 4, 999);
5528        }
5529    }
